task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 101°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need the full facade/roofline in view to estimate height, so I should pitch up while keeping the building centered.
The target building is supposed to be to the east (~101°), so I should rotate right to bring it back into view while staying pitched up to capture the roofline.
I still need the roof/top edge of the building to estimate total height, so I should tilt up while keeping the same heading toward the facade.
The view has snapped back to 0° while pitched up, so I should rotate right again to face the east building and keep the upward pitch to see the top.
To estimate height I need both ground reference and roofline in one view, so I'll step back slightly to fit more of the building vertically.
After moving, I'm no longer facing the target (east ~101°), so I should rotate right about 110° to re-center the building.
Now that I'm facing the building again, I should tilt up to capture the roofline for a height estimate using visible floors as reference.
The heading reset again to 0° while pitched up, so I need to rotate right to ~110° to view the target building’s upper portion.
Since pitch keeps resetting, I'll estimate from this straight-on view using apparent number of stories and typical story height.
